Evidence_Type: Medical evidence, social context evidence, anti-discrimination laws, medication availability, systemic barriers
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution based on sexual orientation and HIV status
Key_Factor_in_Determination: HIV-related stigma, employment restrictions, lack of family support
Application_Error: Failure to consider HIV-positive status in IFA analysis
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, case referred for redetermination
Assessment_Standard: Two-pronged IFA test: (1) no serious possibility of persecution; (2) reasonable to seek refuge
Evidence_Ignored: Systemic barriers such as HIV-related stigma, employment limitations, lack of family support
Application_Factor: Applicant's health condition and social vulnerability
Decision_Review_Issue: Did the Board err in IFA analysis by failing to consider HIV status?
Cause_of_Refusal: Inadequate assessment of IFA due to omission of HIV-related challenges
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to address critical evidence on HIV stigma and support systems
Procedural_Fairness: Board failed to provide adequate reasons regarding key personal factors
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Boardâ€™s IFA determination
Relevant_Law: IRPA, principles of refugee protection, international human rights standards
Procedural_Issue: Omission in analysis affecting fairness and completeness
Omission_Type: Failure to consider applicant's HIV status and related vulnerabilities
